intro: Phoenicoseris, commonly known as the golden sandwort, is a member of the Montiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in its harsh environment. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, adding a striking visual contrast to its green foliage. Phoenicoseris is adapted to sandy soils and can thrive in conditions with limited rainfall.
